Foreign Office, 7th November } 1940. London, S.W.l. FILE copy Sir I am directed hy Viscount Halifax to state, for the information of the Secretary of State for India that Mr. Fazlollah Nabil, Counsellor of the Iranian legation in London is returning to Iran via the Cape and Bombay and is taking with him documents belonging to the Legation which are being sent to Tehran in consequence of the Legation premises having been damaged by a bomb. 2. Mr. Nabil has requested that he may be issued with a laissez-passer to secure his safe passage through the British territories concerned. He has been informed that it is not the practice to issue such documents, but that the competent authorities would be asked to extend to him such facilities as may be necessary. 3. Mr. Nabil is travelling on the S.S. 'Narkunda' which is leaving this country shortly and Lord Halifax will be glad if the authorities at Bombay may be notified accordingly. I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant The Under-Secretary of State India Office. RECd. POL. DEPt. a NOV1940 INDIA OFFICE

titleInfo.title: PZ 6079/40 Correspondence requesting that Facilities for Safe Passage between London and Tehran be granted to Mr Fazlollah Nabil of the Persian Legation, London

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the Foreign Office to the India Office, communicating the desire of Viscount Halifax, Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, that facilities for safe passage should be extended to Mr Fazlollah Nabil, Counsellor of the Persian Legation in London, as he travels to Tehran with Legation documents. The file also contains a copy of a letter sent from the India Office to the Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department, requesting that the local authorities be instructed to extend such facilities.
